dmca.title: [ABUSE] Copyright Infringement Notice ID: 9-367016]
dmca.body:
----Original Message-----
From: The Planet Policy Enforcement [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com] 
Sent: Thursday, June 16, 2005 6:04 PM
To: mgm-no-reply@copyright-compliance.com
Cc: copyright@theplanet.com
Subject: [Fwd: [ABUSE] Copyright Infringement Notice ID: 9-367016]

-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1

Your email is being forwarded on to our Copyright counsel for review, at the
address of copyright@theplanet.com.


- -------- Original Message --------
Subject: [ABUSE] Copyright Infringement Notice ID: 9-367016
Date: Wed, 15 Jun 2005 18:36:49 -0700
From: mgm-no-reply@copyright-compliance.com
Reply-To: mgm-no-reply@copyright-compliance.com
To: abuse@theplanet.com

Re:  Unauthorized Use of MGM Property
Notice ID:9-367016
Notice  Date:16 Jun 2005 00:46:47 GMT

Dear Sir or Madam:

MGM Inc. and its affiliated companies (collectively, "MGM") are the
exclusive owners of copyrights in motion pictures and television, including
the property listed below.

It has come to our attention that ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc.
is the service provider for the IP address listed below, from which
unauthorized copying and distribution (downloading, uploading, file serving,
file "swapping" or other similar activities) of  MGM's
(property)(s) listed below is taking place.  We believe that the Internet
access of the user engaging in this infringement is provided by
ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc. or a downstream service provider who
purchases this connectivity from ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc..

This unauthorized copying and distribution constitutes copyright
infringement under Section 106 of the U.S. Copyright Act .  Depending upon
the type of service ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc. is providing to
this IP address, it may have legal and/or equitable liability if it does not
expeditiously remove or disable access to the
(property)(s) listed below, or if it fails to implement a policy that
provides for termination of subscribers who are repeat infringers (see,
17 U.S.C.
